subject: mathematics
question_text: Which of the following fractions is equivalent to \(\dfrac{3}{8} + \dfrac{1}{4}\)?
explanation: First convert \(\dfrac{1}{4}\) to a denominator of 8: \(\dfrac{1}{4}=\dfrac{2}{8}\). Then add the fractions: \(\dfrac{3}{8}+\dfrac{2}{8}=\dfrac{5}{8}\). The fraction \(\dfrac{5}{8}\) is already in simplest form, so it is the correct answer.
